{{velocity output="true"}} #set($sessionId= $request.sessionId) #if($sessionId.startsWith('MailArchivePrefs.LoadingSession_')) #set($sessionId = $sessionId.substring(0,32)) #end ## Check if scheduler plugin is installed... #if($xwiki.scheduler.name) #if("$!sessionId" != "") ## Only 1 session - user clicked on "schedule" link from Loading page #set($sessiondoc = $xwiki.getDocument("MailArchivePrefs.LoadingSession_${sessionId}")) #set($sessionobj = $sessiondoc.getObject('MailArchiveCode.LoadingSessionClass')) #set($jobdocname = "$!sessionobj.jobname") #if("$!jobdocname" == "") ## Must create job page #set($jobdocname = $xwiki.getUniquePageName("MailArchivePrefs", "MailArchiveJob")) #set($jobdocname = "MailArchivePrefs.$jobdocname") ## Set job name in session ## Associate the session to the job #set($discard = $sessionobj.set('job', $jobdocname)) #set($discard = $sessiondoc.save('set job name'))
#set($discard = $xwiki.copyDocument("MailArchiveCode.LoadingJobTemplate", $jobdocname)) ## Associate the job to the session #set($jobdoc = $xwiki.getDocument("$jobdocname")) #set($jobobj = $jobdoc.newObject('MailArchiveCode.ScheduledSessionClass')) #set($discard = $jobobj.set('sessions', $sessionId )) ## Save #set($discard = $jobdoc.save('set session name')) #end ## Redirect to the scheduled job page $response.sendRedirect($jobdoc.getURL('view')) #end #else Scheduler plugin is not installed - it is needed to schedule loading jobs inside XWiki instance. You can either: * Install the scheduler plugin and application in your wiki * Schedule your loading operation externally, by performing an HTTP GET against following url: $xwiki.getDocument('MailArchiveCode.LoadService').getExternalURL('view', "sessionId=${sessionId}") #end {{/velocity}}
